info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 28 at 8:53PM EST until December 29 at 2:42PM EST by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following river in North Carolina... South Fork Catawba River At Lowell affecting Gaston County. .Stages along the South fork Catawba River at Lowell continue to fall slowly tonight, but will fall below flood stage overnight and then below action stage through Friday. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY TOMORROW AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring. * WHERE...South Fork Catawba River at Lowell. * WHEN...Until early tomorrow afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 9.0 feet, Action/Advisory Stage. South Fork Catawba River floodwaters impact Riverside Park in Cramerton. At 10.0 feet, Minor Flood Stage. South Fork Catawba River floodwaters inundate Goat Island Park. More significant inundation continues at Riverside Park. Floodwaters approach Riverside Drive near 5th and 6th Streets in Cramerton. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:15 PM EST Thursday the stage was 10.0 feet. - Bankfull stage is 9.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 8:15 PM EST Thursday was 11.4 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage after midnight and then continue to below action stage by noon Friday, falling to 7.0 feet by Friday evening. - Flood stage is 10.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 10.0 feet on 04/20/2015. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. For detailed information including observed and forecast stages, flood impacts, flood history, FEMA Flood Hazard Layers, and more, please visit: https://water.weather.gov/ahps2/index.php?wfo=gsp The next statement will be issued Friday morning at 1100 AM EST.
